canonical_explanation.text: The Sun gives us light and heat during the day. When the sun rises, it is morning and daytime begins. When the sun sets, evening comes and then night. At night, we see the moon and stars in the sky. During the day, we go to school, play, and do our work. At night, we eat dinner, spend time with family, and sleep.
rules: The Sun gives us light and heat during the day.
Sun rises in the morning and sets in the evening.
At night, we see the moon and stars.
We do activities like school and play during the day.
At night, we rest and sleep.

questions.question_text: What gives us light during the day?
questions.explanation_correct: The Sun gives us light during the day. The Sun is a big, bright star that shines in the sky and its light helps us see everything around us during the day.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The moon and stars do not give us light during the day. The moon and stars are only visible in the sky at night. A lamp also cannot give us light during the day because it is not as bright as the Sun. The Sun is the source of light that helps us see everything during the day.

questions.question_text: When does the sun rise?
questions.explanation_correct: The sun rises in the morning. This is because the Earth spins, and as it does, the sun appears in the sky, bringing light and warmth for the day.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The sun does not rise at night or at midnight. It rises in the morning, when the Earth's rotation brings the sun into view. The sun also does not set in the evening - it sets at night, when the Earth's rotation moves the sun out of view.

questions.question_text: When does the sun set?
questions.explanation_correct: The sun sets in the evening. This is when the sun goes down and it becomes night time. During the evening, the sky gets darker and we can see the moon and stars come out.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The sun does not set in the morning or at midnight. In the morning, the sun rises and it is daytime. At midnight, it is the middle of the night and the sun is not visible. The sun sets in the evening, when it gets darker outside and nighttime begins.

questions.question_text: What does the sun give us?
questions.explanation_correct: The sun gives us both light and heat. During the day, the sun's light and warmth help us see and feel cozy. Without the sun, we would not have daytime.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The sun does not just give us light or just give us heat - it gives us both light and heat. The sun's light and warmth are important for our daily life, like going to school, playing, and doing our work during the day.

questions.question_text: What appears in the sky at night?
questions.explanation_correct: The moon and stars appear in the sky at night. This is because when the sun goes down, the moon and stars become visible in the dark night sky.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The sun does not appear in the sky at night. The sun gives us light and heat during the day, but at night the sun sets and it becomes dark. Rainbows and clouds are also only seen during the day, not at night. The correct answer is the moon and stars, which we can see shining in the night sky.

questions.question_text: Is night bright or dark?
questions.explanation_correct: Night is dark because the sun is not in the sky. The sun gives us light during the day, but when it sets, it gets dark at night.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Night is not bright because the sun is not out. The sun gives us light and heat during the day, but at night, the sun is gone and it becomes dark. The moon and stars in the sky do not give as much light as the sun, so it is dark at night.

questions.question_text: What gives gentle light at night?
questions.explanation_correct: The moon gives us gentle light at night. The moon reflects sunlight, so we can see it shining in the night sky.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The sun does not give light at night. The sun gives us bright light during the day, but it sets in the evening and it is dark at night. Rainbows and clouds are also not sources of light at night.

questions.question_text: What twinkles in the night sky?
questions.explanation_correct: The stars twinkle in the night sky. The stars are tiny, bright lights that we see in the sky at night. They twinkle or blink because of the Earth's atmosphere.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The sun does not twinkle in the night sky. The sun gives us light and heat during the day, but at night we cannot see the sun. The moon also does not twinkle - it just glows in the night sky. Clouds are made of water and do not twinkle either. The stars are the tiny, bright lights that twinkle in the night sky.

questions.question_text: When do we go to school?
questions.explanation_correct: We go to school during the day when the sun is up and it is bright outside. This is because we need light to see and learn at school.
questions.explanation_incorrect: We do not go to school at night. At night, it is dark outside and we are usually sleeping. We only go to school during the daytime when the sun is up and it is bright outside.

questions.question_text: What do we do in the morning?
questions.explanation_correct: In the morning, we wake up and get ready for the day. We do this because the sun has risen and it is daytime, when we are awake and active.
questions.explanation_incorrect: We do not sleep in the morning. In the morning, the sun has risen and it is daytime. During the day, we are awake and do things like go to school, play, and work. Eating dinner happens at night, after the sun has set and it is dark outside.

questions.question_text: What do we do at night?
questions.explanation_correct: At night, we sleep. When the sun goes down and it gets dark outside, we rest our bodies and minds by sleeping.
questions.explanation_incorrect: We don't go to school, play outside, or study for exams at night. During the day, we do those things. But at night, the right thing to do is to sleep. Sleeping helps our bodies and brains get the rest they need.

questions.question_text: Which meal do we eat at night?
questions.explanation_correct: We eat dinner at night because that is the main meal we have in the evening before going to bed. Dinner is a big meal with lots of different foods that help us feel full and tired so we can sleep well at night.
questions.explanation_incorrect: We do not eat breakfast at night. Breakfast is the meal we have in the morning when we wake up. Lunch is the meal we have in the middle of the day, and a snack is a small food we have in between meals. Dinner is the main meal we have in the evening before going to bed at night.

questions.question_text: You see the sun in the sky. What time is it?
questions.explanation_correct: When you see the sun in the sky, that means it is daytime. The sun rises in the morning and is up in the sky during the day, so the correct answer is that it is day.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The sun is not out at night, so it cannot be nighttime. Midnight is the middle of the night, when the moon and stars are out, not the sun. So the correct answer is that it is day, not night or midnight.

questions.question_text: You see stars in the sky. What time is it?
questions.explanation_correct: You see stars in the sky at night, so the correct answer is C) Night. During the day, we see the sun and the sky is bright, but at night the stars come out and it is dark.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The stars are not visible during the morning, afternoon, or noon. We only see stars in the night sky when it is dark outside. So the correct answer is C) Night.

questions.question_text: Why should we not look directly at the sun?
questions.explanation_correct: The sun is very bright and looking directly at it can hurt our eyes. It can even damage our eyes if we look at it for a long time. That is why we should never look directly at the sun.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The sun is not small or cold. It is actually very big and hot. Looking directly at the sun is not a good idea because the bright light can hurt our eyes and even damage them. We should always be careful not to look directly at the sun.

questions.question_text: When do children play outside usually?
questions.explanation_correct: Children usually play outside during the day because that is when the Sun is up and it is bright outside. The Sun gives us light and heat during the day, so that is the best time for children to go outside and play.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Children do not play outside at midnight because it is nighttime. At night, the Sun is gone, and it is dark outside. This is the time when children are usually sleeping and resting, not playing outside.

questions.question_text: Why do we need to sleep at night?
questions.explanation_correct: We need to sleep at night to rest and grow. When we sleep, our body and mind can take a break and get ready for the next day. Sleeping helps us feel energized and healthy.
questions.explanation_incorrect: We don't need to stay awake at night. Staying awake all the time can make us feel tired and cranky. Eating more food or playing games is not the reason we need to sleep at night. We sleep at night to rest our bodies and minds so we can be ready to learn, play, and do our work during the day.

questions.question_text: The moon changes its ___.
questions.explanation_correct: The moon changes its shape as it goes through different phases, from a full moon to a crescent moon and back again. This is why the correct answer is B) Shape.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The moon does not change its color or size. The moon's appearance changes because it orbits around the Earth, and we can see different amounts of the moon's surface at different times. The correct answer is that the moon changes its shape as it goes through its phases.

questions.question_text: When do we eat breakfast?
questions.explanation_correct: We eat breakfast in the morning because that is when the sun rises and the day begins. Breakfast is the first meal of the day, so we have it in the morning before going to school or starting our day.
questions.explanation_incorrect: We do not eat breakfast at night or at midnight because those are times when it is dark outside and we are usually sleeping. Breakfast is a meal we have in the morning when the sun is up and we are awake and ready to start our day.

questions.question_text: Which bird comes out at night?
questions.explanation_correct: The owl comes out at night. Owls are special birds that can see very well in the dark and hunt for food at night.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The sparrow, parrot, and crow are all birds that come out during the day, not at night. Owls are the birds that are active at night and can see in the dark to find their food.

questions.question_text: Is the sun hot or cold?
questions.explanation_correct: The sun is very hot. The sun is a big, bright star that gives us light and heat during the day. This makes the sun very hot, much hotter than water or anything else on Earth.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The sun is not cold. The sun is a very hot, bright star that warms the Earth and makes it daytime when it is up in the sky. The sun is not the same temperature as water, which is much cooler. The sun is much, much hotter than water or anything else on Earth.

questions.question_text: When do we do homework usually?
questions.explanation_correct: We do homework during the day or in the evening because that's when we are awake and can focus on our work. At night, we sleep and rest, so we don't do homework then.
questions.explanation_incorrect: We don't do homework while sleeping because we are resting at night. We also don't do homework at midnight, which is very late at night. The correct time to do homework is during the day or in the evening when we are awake and can concentrate on our work.

questions.question_text: What animal sleeps during the day and wakes at night?
questions.explanation_correct: The bat sleeps during the day and wakes up at night. Bats are nocturnal animals, which means they are active at night and sleep during the day.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The cat, dog, and cow are not nocturnal like the bat. They are awake and active during the day, not at night. The bat is the only animal in the options that sleeps during the day and wakes up to be active at night.

questions.question_text: Why is it bright during the day?
questions.explanation_correct: It is bright during the day because of the sun. The sun gives us light and heat, which makes it bright outside during the day.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The sun, not the moon or stars, is what makes it bright during the day. The sun's light shines on the Earth and makes it bright outside. Lamps also give light, but they are used at night when it's dark, not during the day when the sun is shining.

questions.question_text: What do families do together in the evening?
questions.explanation_correct: Families spend time together and have dinner in the evening. At night, we rest and sleep after a long day.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Going to school and going to the office happen during the day. At night, families spend time together, have dinner, and get ready to sleep. They do not sleep all day.

questions.question_text: Can we see the sun at night?
questions.explanation_correct: No, we cannot see the sun at night. The sun gives us light during the day, but at night the earth turns away from the sun and it gets dark. This is why we can only see the moon and stars in the sky at night.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The sun is not visible at night because the earth rotates, and at night time the earth is facing away from the sun. The sun only shines during the day when the earth is facing it. So, we cannot see the sun at night, even though it is always there in the sky.

questions.question_text: When do we brush our teeth in the morning?
questions.explanation_correct: We brush our teeth after waking up in the morning because that is when our teeth need to be cleaned the most. Brushing after waking up helps keep our teeth healthy and strong.
questions.explanation_incorrect: We do not brush our teeth only at night. We need to brush our teeth both in the morning after waking up and at night before going to sleep. Brushing in the morning is important to clean our teeth and get rid of any food or germs that built up while we were sleeping.

questions.question_text: Plants need ___ from the sun to make food.
questions.explanation_correct: Plants need light from the sun to make their own food. The sun gives plants the energy they need to grow and be healthy.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Plants do not need water, air, or soil to make their own food. They need light from the sun to turn that light into food through a process called photosynthesis. This is why the correct answer is that plants need light from the sun to make food.

questions.question_text: What story do parents tell at bedtime?
questions.explanation_correct: Parents tell bedtime stories to help children go to sleep at night. Bedtime stories are special stories that are read or told before bed, so the correct answer is B) Bedtime story.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is B) Bedtime story. Parents do not tell morning stories, school stories, or no stories at bedtime. Bedtime stories are special stories that parents read or tell their children to help them sleep at night.

questions.question_text: How many stars can we see at night?
questions.explanation_correct: At night, we can see many stars in the sky. The stars are shining brightly and we can see lots of them when it is dark outside.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Option A 'None' is not correct because we can definitely see stars in the sky at night. Option B 'Only one' is also not correct because we can see many stars, not just one. Option D 'Two' is not correct either because we can see much more than just two stars in the night sky.

questions.question_text: The sun gives us light.
questions.explanation_correct: The sun gives us light during the day. We can see the sun in the sky during the day, and it helps us see everything around us.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The sun does not give us light at night. At night, we see the moon and stars in the sky instead of the sun. The sun only gives us light and warmth during the day, when it is in the sky.

questions.question_text: The sun rises at night.
questions.explanation_correct: The sun does not rise at night. The sun rises in the morning and sets in the evening, so it is always daytime when the sun is up.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The sun rises during the day, not at night. When the sun sets in the evening, it gets dark and we can see the moon and stars in the night sky. The sun only rises in the morning to start the day.

questions.question_text: We see stars at night.
questions.explanation_correct: We see stars at night because the sky is dark. The sun gives us light during the day, so we can't see the stars. But at night, when the sun goes down, the sky gets dark and we can see the stars shining brightly.
questions.explanation_incorrect: We can't see the stars during the day because the sun is too bright. The sun gives us light and heat, so the sky is not dark enough to see the stars. But at night, when the sun goes down, the sky gets dark and we can see the stars twinkling in the sky.

questions.question_text: The moon gives us very bright light like the sun.
questions.explanation_correct: The moon does not give us bright light like the sun. The moon only reflects the sun's light, so it is much dimmer than the sun.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The sun is the main source of light and heat during the day. The moon, on the other hand, does not produce its own light. The moon reflects the sun's light, which is why we can see it at night. The moon's light is much weaker than the sun's light.

questions.question_text: We go to school during the day.
questions.explanation_correct: We go to school during the day because the sun is out and we can see clearly. The sun gives us light and heat during the day, so that's when we have school.
questions.explanation_incorrect: We do not go to school at night because it is dark outside and we cannot see properly. The sun sets in the evening, and then it becomes night time. At night, we see the moon and stars in the sky. During the night, we eat dinner, spend time with our family, and sleep.

questions.question_text: We sleep during the day.
questions.explanation_correct: We sleep at night, not during the day. When the sun goes down and it gets dark, that's when it's time to sleep. During the day when the sun is up, we are awake and do things like go to school, play, and work.
questions.explanation_incorrect: It's not true that we sleep during the day. During the day, the sun is up and it's bright outside. That's when we are awake and active, going to school, playing, and doing our work. We sleep at night when it's dark and the moon and stars are in the sky.

questions.question_text: The sun is very cold.
questions.explanation_correct: The sun is very hot, not cold. The sun gives us warmth and light during the day. That's why the answer 'The sun is very cold' is false.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The sun is a star that gives us lots of heat and light. It is very, very hot, not cold. The sun's warmth helps plants and animals on Earth. So the statement 'The sun is very cold' is not correct.

questions.question_text: Owls wake up at night.
questions.explanation_correct: Owls wake up at night because they are birds that are active at night, not during the day. Owls can see very well in the dark, so they hunt for food and move around at night time.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Some animals like cats and dogs are awake during the day and asleep at night. But owls are different - they are birds that are active at night time, not during the day. Owls can see very well in the dark, so they hunt for food and move around when it is dark outside.

questions.question_text: Stars twinkle in the sky.
questions.explanation_correct: The stars twinkle in the sky at night. This is because the light from the stars gets bent by the Earth's atmosphere, making them appear to twinkle.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The stars do not twinkle during the day because the bright sunlight makes it hard to see them. At night, when it is dark, the stars shine brightly and their light gets bent by the Earth's atmosphere, causing them to twinkle and look like they are shining and moving.

questions.question_text: We play outside at midnight.
questions.explanation_correct: We do not play outside at midnight because it is night time. At night, it is dark and we sleep.
questions.explanation_incorrect: We do not play outside at midnight because it is very late at night. During the day, we go to school, play, and do our work. At night, we eat dinner, spend time with our family, and sleep.

questions.question_text: The ___ gives us light during the day.
questions.explanation_correct: The sun gives us light during the day because it is a star that shines brightly in the sky. The sun's light and heat make it daytime when we can see clearly and do our activities.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The moon does not give us light during the day. The correct answer is the sun. The sun is a star that shines brightly in the sky and gives us light and heat during the day. The moon is only visible at night, when we can see it and the stars in the sky.

questions.question_text: The sun rises in the ___.
questions.explanation_correct: The sun rises in the morning because that is when the sun first appears in the sky and the day begins. During the day, the sun gives us light and heat to help us see and do our work.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The sun does not rise in the evening or at night. It rises in the morning, which is the beginning of the day. The correct answer is 'morning'.

questions.question_text: The sun sets in the ___.
questions.explanation_correct: The sun sets in the evening because that is when the sun goes down and it becomes dark outside. During the day, the sun is up in the sky and gives us light and warmth. But in the evening, the sun goes down and it becomes nighttime.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The sun does not set in the morning or at night. It sets in the evening, when the day is ending and it's starting to get dark outside. The correct answer is 'evening'.

questions.question_text: The ___ and stars appear at night.
questions.explanation_correct: The moon and stars appear in the sky at night because the sun is not out. During the day, the sun is shining and we can see it, but at night the sun goes down and we can see the moon and the stars instead.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The sun, moon, and stars do not appear at night. The correct answer is the moon. At night, we can see the moon and stars in the sky, but we cannot see the sun because it has set and it is dark outside.

questions.question_text: ___ twinkle in the night sky.
questions.explanation_correct: The answer is 'Stars' because at night, we can see many small, bright objects in the sky. These are called stars, and they twinkle and shine brightly in the dark night sky.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The answer is not 'Clouds' or 'Moon'. Clouds are in the sky during the day, not the night. The moon is also a bright object in the night sky, but it does not twinkle like the stars do. The correct answer is 'Stars', which are the small, shiny objects that we can see in the night sky.

questions.question_text: We go to ___ during the day.
questions.explanation_correct: We go to school during the day because that's where we learn and play with our friends. School is the place we spend most of our daytime hours.
questions.explanation_incorrect: We do not go to the park or our home during the day. We go to school during the day to learn and have fun with our classmates. The correct answer is 'school'.

questions.question_text: We ___ at night.
questions.explanation_correct: We sleep at night because that's when it's dark and quiet. Our bodies rest and recharge while we sleep, so we can have energy to play and learn during the daytime.
questions.explanation_incorrect: We do not play or go to school at night. At night, when it's dark, we need to rest and sleep so we can have energy for the next day. The correct answer is 'sleep' because that's what we do at night.

questions.question_text: ___ is a bird that wakes up at night.
questions.explanation_correct: Owl is a bird that wakes up at night. Owls are nocturnal animals, which means they are active at night and sleep during the day. They have excellent vision and hearing that helps them hunt and move around in the dark.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'Owl'. Owls are the birds that wake up and are active at night. Other birds like chickens, pigeons, and sparrows are active during the day and sleep at night. Owls have special features like large eyes and sharp talons that help them see and hunt in the dark.

questions.question_text: We eat ___ in the morning.
questions.explanation_correct: We eat breakfast in the morning because that is the first meal of the day. Breakfast gives us the energy and nutrients we need to start our day and go to school, play, and do our work.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'breakfast'. We do not eat lunch or dinner in the morning. Breakfast is the meal we have first thing when we wake up and start our day. It is important to have a healthy breakfast to feel energized and ready for our activities during the day.

questions.question_text: We eat ___ at night.
questions.explanation_correct: We eat dinner at night because that is the main meal we have in the evening when the sun goes down. Dinner is the big meal we have before going to bed for the night.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'dinner'. We don't eat breakfast or lunch at night, we have those meals during the day. Dinner is the meal we have in the evening before going to sleep for the night.

questions.question_text: The sun gives us light and ___.
questions.explanation_correct: The sun gives us light and heat because the sun is a giant ball of hot gases. The sun's heat and light help keep our planet warm and bright during the day.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The sun gives us light, but it does not give us cold. The sun is very hot, so it gives us heat, not cold. The correct answer is 'heat'.

questions.question_text: Night is ___ because there is no sun.
questions.explanation_correct: Night is dark because there is no sun. The sun gives us light during the day, but at night the sun is not shining on our part of the Earth, so it is dark.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Night is not dark, it is bright. This is incorrect because at night, the sun is not out and there is no sunlight. The correct answer is 'dark' because without the sun, it becomes dark at night.

questions.question_text: Put in order: From morning to night.
questions.explanation_correct: The correct order is Sun rises, Sun shines, Sun sets because that is how the day goes. First the sun rises in the morning, then it shines brightly during the day, and finally it sets in the evening. This is the natural cycle of day and night that we see every day.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect order would be Sun shines, Sun rises, Sun sets. This is not correct because the sun has to rise first before it can shine, and then it sets after shining all day. The right order is Sun rises, Sun shines, Sun sets, which shows the complete cycle of day and night.

questions.question_text: Put in order: Your morning routine.
questions.explanation_correct: The order of your morning routine is correct because you need to wake up first, then brush your teeth, and finally go to school. This is the right order to get ready for the day.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct order of your morning routine is: Wake up, Brush teeth, Go to school. You cannot go to school without first waking up and brushing your teeth. The right order is important to get ready for the day and start your morning properly.

questions.question_text: Put in order: Your night routine.
questions.explanation_correct: The correct order is Have dinner, Brush teeth, Go to sleep because this is the usual order we follow at night. First, we have our dinner to get energy, then we brush our teeth to keep them clean, and finally we go to sleep to rest our body.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect order would be Go to sleep, Have dinner, Brush teeth. This is not correct because we need to have our dinner before going to sleep, and then we need to brush our teeth to keep them healthy before going to bed.

questions.question_text: Put times of day in order.
questions.explanation_correct: The correct order is Morning, Afternoon, Night because that is how the day goes. First, the sun rises in the morning, then it is daytime in the afternoon, and finally it gets dark at night.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect order would be Night, Afternoon, Morning. This is wrong because the day starts in the morning, then becomes afternoon, and finally turns to night. The correct order is Morning, Afternoon, Night.

questions.question_text: Put in order: What happens at sunset.
questions.explanation_correct: The sun goes down first, which makes the sky get dark. Then, the stars start to appear in the dark sky. This is the right order of what happens at sunset.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct order is: Sun goes down, Sky gets dark, Stars appear. If the stars appeared first, it would still be daytime and the sky wouldn't be dark yet. The sun has to go down first before the sky gets dark and the stars can be seen.
